channel.title: Comments on: In Drug Cases, Cross-Examine that “Expert”!

item.title: By: Matt Haiduk
item.dc:creator: Matt Haiduk
item.description: Great post! I'm always looking for stuff to add to the criminal law tool belt. Just ordered the book, can't wait to get it (even if it is a little pricey).
item.content:encoded: Great post! I’m always looking for stuff to add to the criminal law tool belt. Just ordered the book, can’t wait to get it (even if it is a little pricey).

item.title: By: James Shellow on Cross-Examining the Analyst in a Drug Prosecution | Koehler Law
item.dc:creator: James Shellow on Cross-Examining the Analyst in a Drug Prosecution | Koehler Law
item.description: [...] James Shellow’s Cross-Examination of the Analyst in Drug Prosecutions. The book came highly recommended by my friend and colleague, Noah Clements. Also contributing to my decision to buy the book was the [...]
item.content:encoded: […] James Shellow’s Cross-Examination of the Analyst in Drug Prosecutions. The book came highly recommended by my friend and colleague, Noah Clements. Also contributing to my decision to buy the book was the […]

item.title: By: Jamison
item.dc:creator: Jamison
item.description: Noah: Thanks for the recommendation on the LexisNexis publication on cross-examining a drug analyst. And, yes, I too was amazed the first time I saw Bryan Brown try a DUI case.
item.content:encoded: Noah: Thanks for the recommendation on the LexisNexis publication on cross-examining a drug analyst. And, yes, I too was amazed the first time I saw Bryan Brown try a DUI case.
